english: hot pot; a Chinese cooking method

etymology.interpretation: 火锅 refers to a style of Chinese cooking where various ingredients are cooked in a pot of simmering broth at the table. It is a popular communal eating experience in Chinese culture.
etymology.simplification: The character 锅 in 火锅 was simplified from 鍋 by reducing the number of strokes in the component 钅 (metal radical), commonly simplified in many characters.

examples.chinese: 我们今晚去吃火锅(我們今晚去吃火鍋)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen jīn wǎn qù chī huǒguō.
examples.english: We are going to eat hot pot tonight.

examples.chinese: 火锅在冬天很受欢迎(火鍋在冬天很受歡迎)。
examples.pinyin: Huǒguō zài dōngtiān hěn shòu huānyíng.
examples.english: Hot pot is very popular in winter.
